title: So Long, London
author: Taylor Swift
lyrics:
[00:29.70] I saw in my mind fairy lights through the mist
[00:32.86] I kept calm and carried the weight of the rift
[00:35.83] Pulled him in tighter each time he was drifting away
[00:41.26] My spine split from carrying us up the hill
[00:44.82] Wet through my clothes, weary bones caught the chill
[00:48.05] I stopped trying to make him laugh
[00:50.05] Stopped trying to drill the safe
[00:53.78] Thinkin, how much sad did you think I had
[00:59.17] Did you think I had in me?
[01:03.56] Oh, the tragedy ...
[01:06.07] So long, London
[01:11.36] You'll find someone ...
[01:19.32] I didn't opt in to be your odd man out
[01:22.31] I founded the club she's heard great things about
[01:25.35] I left all I knew, you left me at the house by the Heath
[01:31.24] I stopped CPR, after all it's no use
[01:34.28] The spirit was gone, we would never come to
[01:37.55] And I'm pissed off you let me give you all that youth for free
[01:43.09] For so long, London
[01:49.02] Stitches undone
[01:55.18] Two graves, one gun
[02:01.13] I'll find someone ...
[02:08.78] And you say I abandoned the ship
[02:11.05] But I was going down with it
[02:13.84] My white knuckle dying grip
[02:17.57] Holding tight to your quiet resentment and
[02:20.18] My friends said it isn't right to be scared
[02:23.46] Every day of a love affair
[02:25.96] Every breath feels like rarest air
[02:29.66] When you're not sure if he wants to be there
[02:32.15] So how much sad did you think I had,
[02:37.36] Did you think I had in me?
[02:42.82] How much tragedy?
[02:46.09] Just how low did you think I'd go?
[02:50.73] Before I'd self-implode
[02:54.05] Before I'd have to go be free
[03:00.04] You swore that you loved me but where were the clues?
[03:02.68] I died on the altar waiting for the proof
[03:05.73] You sacrificed us to the gods of your bluest days
[03:11.62] And I'm just getting color back into my face
[03:17.14] I'm just mad as hell cause I loved this place
[03:24.20] For so long, London
[03:27.48] Had a good run
[03:35.97] A moment of warm sun
[03:42.72] But I'm not the one
[03:48.33] So long, London
[03:54.12] Stitches undone
[03:59.81] Two graves, one gun
[04:05.89] You'll find someone ...
[04:11.75]
